did.abstract: Grand Rapids, Michigan, high school teacher and author best known for her writing on Greek and ancient mythology. Papers include correspondence concerning her studies of classical subjects, poems, publications and excerpts from reviews.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was received in 1950 from Mrs. Hulst (donor no 2715) through Albert Hyma.

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Cornelia Steketee Hulst papers, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Cornelia Steketee was born in Grand Rapids, Michigan in 1865, the daughter of John Steketee, vice-consul for the Netherlands. She attended the University of Michigan, 1887-1989 but did not complete a degree. She married Henry Hulst (U-M, M.D. 1888) in 1889 and settled in Grand Rapids where she began a thirty year career as a high school teacher. She was the first woman elected as president of the Michigan Education Association. She retired from teaching in 1917 as head of the English Department as Grand Rapids Central High School. Hulst was awarded an honorary degree from the University of Michigan in 1914.

After retiring from teaching Hulst became a noted writer and researcher on classical mythology. She authored numerous articles and books on the subject including Balders's Death and Loke's Punishment (1918), Homer and the Prophets (1925) and St. George of Cappadocia) (1905. She also wrote on the history mythology of other cultures, notablyIndian sketches: Père Marquette and the last of the Pottawatomie chiefs .
Cornelia Hulst died September 24, 1956 in Grand Rapids.

The Cornelia Steketee Hulst papers include correspondence concerning her studies of classical subjects, poems, publications and excerpts from reviews. Correspondents include: Harry B. Hutchins, and John A. Scott.

scopecontent.p: The Cornelia Steketee Hulst papers include correspondence concerning her studies of classical subjects, poems, publications and excerpts from reviews.

note.p: (includes typescripts of several articles and reviews of her writings. )
